thread.title: Czech Republic registers record increase in visitor and overnight staysTravelandtourworld.com
thread.title_full: Czech Republic registers record increase in visitor and overnight staysTravelandtourworld.com

author: travelandtourworld.com
title: Czech Republic registers record increase in visitor and overnight staysTravelandtourworld.com
text:
Czech Republic registers record increase in visitor and overnight stays
Occupancy in Czech Republic has been growing five quarters in row. The number of guests in collective accommodation establishments increased by 9.3 percent year-on-year and the number of overnight stays by 7.8 percent in the second quarter of 2015.
The number of overnight stays in collective accommodation establishments totaled 11.5 million in Q2. The number of nights of residents went up by 10.0 percent; while foreign guests spent 6.1 percent more nights in accommodation establishments.
The number of overnight stays in hotels went up by 7.7 percent, in pensions by 7.0 percent and in other collective establishments by 8.7 percent.
Moravian-Silesian region recorded highest growth (+16.5percent) followed by Pardubice region (+15.4 percent) and Plze≈à region (+14.2 percent). The lowest growth showed accommodation establishments in Karlovy Vary region (+0.4 percent).
Domestic and foreign guests went up by 10.4 percent and by 8.4 percent respectively.
The highest number of foreign guests by nationality came as usual from Germany. Germans accounted for 20.1 percent of foreign guests at surveyed establishments with 481,000 arrivals. The second largest group of foreign guests was visitors from the United States of America at 156,000 with a year-on-year increase by 15.1 percent. Third place was taken by Slovakia with 150,000 arrivals, year-on-year increase by 16.1 percent. Russians year-on-year dropped by 34.4 percent and took fifth place right behind arrivals from Poland, up 3.8 percent.
